if at all: You use if at all to give emphasis in negative statements, conditional clauses, and questions.
in great measure: If something is true in great measure, it is mostly true.
be tied to: If one thing is tied to another or two things are tied, the two things have a close connection or link.
regardless of: If something happens regardless of something else, it is not affected or influenced at all by that other thing.
now that: You use now or now that to indicate that an event has occurred and as a result something else may or will happen.
comply with: If someone or something complies with an order or set of rules, they do what is required or expected.
for fear of: If you take a particular course of action for fear of something, you take the action in order to prevent that thing happening.
wax and wane: If something waxes and wanes, it first increases and then decreases over a period of time.
